result.execSummary:
The defendant Vernell Terrell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Submit a DNA sample if not already done.   Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge.  To be paid out of up to 25% of prison wages.   Any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Concurrent with: Concurrent with his revocation in 07CF4613.
Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program after serving one half (1/2) of Initial Confinement.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment.
No illegal drugs, contact with drug communtity or with Louis R.  .  No controlled substances without valid prescription.
Alcohol and drug assessment.  Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  Random urine screens.  No positive results.

supervisions.notes: Defendant advised that he may nver again possess firearms or weapons; civil rights suspended until reinstated.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Vernell Terrell

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Vernell Terrell in court with attorney Gregg H Novack.  Defendant Vernell Terrell in custody.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.    Sentencing proceeded.    Statements made by counsel and defendant.  


 The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 5 years, concurrent with his revocation in 07CF4613.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 30 months with credit for 55 days
time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 30 months.
Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:

*
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
*No contact with Louis R.

  - Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, out of up to 25% prison wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program after serving 1/2 of initial confinement, but does not qualify for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Attorney Gregg H Novack in court, defendant Vernell Terrell not in court, in custody.  Patricia I Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 06-04-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Vernell Terrell in court with attorney Gregg H Novack.  Defendant Vernell Terrell in custody.  Paul Hauer for Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Mary Schmitz-MPD Detective. Court took judical notice of certified documents regarding case #08CF5033 that are attached to the complaint.  Exhibit #1 is marked, offered and received into evidence.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Exhibit is ordered withdrawn.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Vernell Terrell in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Vernell Terrell in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.
